intro: Hieracium waldsteinii subsp. waldsteinii, commonly known as the Waldstein’s hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and eastern Europe. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. The plant features bright yellow flowers arranged in a single terminal inflorescence, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough texture and hairy surfaces, and the stems are usually hairy as well. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties in some traditional uses.
